author: Unreal Engine
description:
Technical artists are often the first line of defense for diagnosing in-game frame rate and memory problems, so it’s important to establish efficient workflows for analyzing those issues and communicating clear optimization recommendations to the content teams. 

In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, Alyssa Reuter of Crystal Dynamics covers helpful out-of-the-box tools in Unreal Engine for diagnosing performance issues, engine modifications that Crystal Dynamics created to work more efficiently, and tools and pipelines the team made to quickly translate data into actionable recommendations. In addition, the session discusses common patterns to look for in profiles and how technical art can act on them.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#TechArt, #GameProfiling, #CrystalDynamics, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestOrlando
title: Technical Artist's Guide to Profiling in Unreal Engine | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, we dive into how to build games in UEFN with Scene Graph, focusing on the flexibility and scalability of the Scene Graph system for game design, how to use components in creative ways, and how creators can build custom components using Verse. 

Learn how to apply game design principles with Scene Graph and Verse to build a team obstacle course game. 

Starting from scratch, you’ll learn how to create a simple platform prefab for a character to jump on, add custom Verse components to get your platforms moving, and quickly iterate to build obstacles that scale, spin, slide, and explode!

Learn more about UEFN here: unrealengine.com/uses/uefn-unreal-editor-for-fortnite

#GameDevelopment, #SceneGraph, #Verse, #UnrealEditorForFortnite, #UEFN, #Fortnite, #UnrealFestOrlando
title: Powering Up Your Projects With Scene Graph and Verse | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, Epic's own Matt Oztalay builds a high-unit-count real-time strategy game (RTS) with an unorthodox visual styling… on mobile! 

Stripped bare of the next-gen graphics features he's come to know and love, he has to rely on Niagara, his wits, and a somewhat loose definition of “numbers” to try and pull this one off. 

Check out the video to see Matt demonstrate how to read from and write to render targets with Niagara (and why); explore how to pack a lot of information into a single float, efficiently creating and using distance fields for interesting effects; learn how to efficiently render a large number of units on mobile; and discover a few other surprises along the way.

Can Matt make it happen? Watch and find out!

Find out more about Unreal Engine for mobile game development here: unrealengine.com/uses/mobile-games

#MobileRTS, #Niagara, #MobileGameDevelopment, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestOrlando
title: Chasing Waterfalls: Using Niagara to Power a Mobile RTS | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Take a first look at Unreal Engine 5.7's innovative new functionality! This fast workflow presentation recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm highlights the top new features in UE 5.7. 

Get up to speed quickly with this whirlwind tour of new features, tools, and functions.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#UE5.7, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestStockholm
title: Unreal Engine 5.7 Sneak Peek | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025
